solution_line_template: Out of every {total_berries_per_handful} berries, she eats {eaten_berries_per_handful}, so only {total_berries_per_handful} strawberries - {eaten_berries_per_handful} strawberry = <<{total_berries_per_handful}-{eaten_berries_per_handful}={berries_in_basket_per_handful}>>{berries_in_basket_per_handful} strawberries go into the basket for each handful.

The basket holds {basket_capacity} strawberries, so it will take {basket_capacity} strawberries / {berries_in_basket_per_handful} strawberries per handful = <<{basket_capacity}/{berries_in_basket_per_handful}={handfuls_to_fill_basket}>>{handfuls_to_fill_basket} handfuls to fill the basket.

So in total, Susan will pick {basket_capacity} strawberries + {handfuls_to_fill_basket} handfuls * {eaten_berries_per_handful} strawberry eaten per handful = <<{basket_capacity}+{handfuls_to_fill_basket}*{eaten_berries_per_handful}={total_berries_picked}>>{total_berries_picked} strawberries.
